source_caption_data.pre_caption: This is an extreme wide scenery shot. Initially, a wide expanse of brown sand occupies the bottom foreground of the frame. The calm ocean is positioned in the middle ground, with the horizon line bisecting the center of the frame, while the sky, filled with large clouds, takes up the top half of the frame in the background. The camera, positioned at a low height, glides forward from the beach, moving over the gentle waves at the shoreline. As it progresses, the sand disappears from the bottom of the frame, and the ocean water comes to fill the entire lower half, becoming the new foreground and middle ground. The shot concludes with the camera moving steadily over the water's surface, while the sky and horizon remain in their initial positions.

Return only the one-paragraph video description without Markdown formatting or introductory text.

First, specify the **shot size** based on the subject's size in the frame if major subjects are present. If the shot size is unclear, describe how much of the subject is visible. If no major subject exists (e.g., a scenery shot), describe the shot size in relation to the scenery.

If **shot size or spatial position** changes, describe how these transitions occur clearly, specifying both the **initial and final states**.

In addition, the human-written captions below already describe the subjects (if any) and the scenery in this video but do not capture their spatial composition and movements.
